intro: Trichostema lineare, commonly known as the linear stickseed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands and along stream banks. Trichostema lineare is known for its ability to self-pollinate and its role in supporting local pollinator populations.
